Action.author: yacovm
Action.body: It's still not merged... this https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/fabric/+/31027/ is the stack of CRs. We are reviewing it, sorry for the delay :)

Action.author: ales
Action.body: yeah, ~muralisr , it's still WIP. May I kindly ask you to check out https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/fabric/+/30994/ and see if everything works as expected? Thx in advance

Action.author: muralisr
Action.body: Absolutely, no worries ~yacovm ~ales ... will checkout the CRs.

Action.author: ales
Action.body: I believe that's it - nothing more needed (barring defects). To handle components that require lifecycle data, we have followed an aggregator approach, where now the aggregator delivers lifecycle data directly to the component that needs it, and is in turn fed data by both legacy and new lifecycle. This approach should make it easier to remove the legacy lifecycle in the future.

Action.author: muralisr
Action.body: Right ... I just saw some glimmerings of it in the change to peer/node/start.go. Will checkout the fix and update here.

Action.author: muralisr
Action.body: ~ales ~yacovm ~denyeart those CRs took care of it.. thanks!

Action.author: ales
Action.body: phew! Thanks for double checking ~muralisr ! I'm closing the issue then.
